tit.j: 金ヶ崎の戦い (南北朝時代)
tit.e: Battle of Kanegasaki (the period of the Northern and Southern Courts)
tit.cmt: 用語リストでは「金ヶ崎の戦い→Battle of Kanagasaki（かながさき）」となっていますが、原文の振り仮名は「かねがさきのたたかい」となっていますので、「金ヶ崎の戦い→Battle of Kanegasaki」としました。
tit.e: Battle of Kanegasaki (the period of the Northern and Southern Courts)
Battle of Kanegasaki (the period of the Northern and Southern Courts)

sen.j: 金ヶ崎の戦い（かねがさきのたたかい）は、南北朝時代 (日本)の1336年（延元元年/建武 (日本)3年）から翌1337年（延元2年/建武4年）にかけて、越前国金ヶ崎城（福井県敦賀市）に籠城する新田義貞率いる南朝 (日本)方の軍勢と、それを攻撃する斯波高経率いる北朝 (日本)方の軍勢との間で行われた戦いである。
sen.e: Battle of Kanegasaki was the battle between the troop of the Southern Court led by Yoshisada NITTA who held Kanegasaki-jo Castle in Echizen Province (Tsuruga City, Fukui Prefecture) and the troop of the Northern Court led by Takatsune SHIBA who attacked the castle from 1336 to 1337 in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.
sen.cmt: 「金ヶ崎の戦い（かねがさきのたたかい）」なので、「金ヶ崎城」の読み方を「かねがさきじょう」に合わせました。ウィキペディアによると、「かながさきじょう」とも「かねがさきじょう」とも読めるようです。http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%87%91%E3%83%B6%E5%B4%8E%E5%9F%8E
sen.e: The Battle of Kanegasaki, was a battle between the troop of the Southern Court (Japan) led by Yoshisada NITTA who held Kanegasaki-jo Castle in Echizen Province (Tsuruga City, Fukui Prefecture), and the troop of the Northern Court (Japan) led by Takatsune SHIBA who attacked the castle, from 1336 to 1337 in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).

sen.e: The Battle of Kanegasaki, was a battle between the troop of the Southern Court (Japan) led by Yoshisada NITTA who held Kanegasaki-jo Castle in Echizen Province (Tsuruga City, Fukui Prefecture), and the troop of the Northern Court (Japan) led by Takatsune SHIBA who attacked the castle, from 1336 to 1337 in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).

sen.j: 1336年（建武 (日本)3年）5月、湊川の戦いで足利尊氏率いる北朝 (日本)方に敗北した南朝 (日本)方は、比叡山に逃れた。
sen.e: In May 1336, the Southern Court was defeated by the Northern Court led by Takauji ASHIKAGA in the Battle of Minato-gawa River and escaped to Mt. Hiei.
In May 1336, the Southern Court (Japan) side was defeated by the Northern Court (Japan) side led by Takauji ASHIKAGA in the Battle of Minato-gawa River, and escaped to Mt. Hiei.

sen.e: In May 1336, the Southern Court (Japan) side was defeated by the Northern Court (Japan) side led by Takauji ASHIKAGA in the Battle of Minato-gawa River, and escaped to Mt. Hiei.

sen.j: 新田義貞は、後醍醐天皇の二人の皇子恒良親王と尊良親王とを伴って下山し、北陸へ落ち延び、氣比神宮の宮司である気比氏治に迎えられ、10月13日_(旧暦)に越前国金ヶ崎城（福井県敦賀市）に入城した。
sen.e: Yoshisada NITTA descended the mountain with two Imperial princes of the Emperor Godaigo: Imperial Prince Tsuneyoshi and Imperial Prince Takayoshi and successfully escaped to the Hokuriku region where he was received by Ujiharu KEHI who was Guji (chief of those who serves shrine, controls festivals and general affairs) of Kehi-jingu Shrine, then entered Kanegasaki-jo Castle in Echizen Province (Tsuruga City, Fukui Prefecture) on November 16 (October 13 in the old calendar).

Yoshisada NITTA descended the mountain with two imperial princes of the Emperor Godaigo: the Imperial Prince Tsuneyoshi and the Imperial Prince Takayoshi, and successfully escaped to the Hokuriku region where they were welcomed by Ujiharu KEHI who was Guji (chief of those who serves shrine, controls festivals and general affairs) of Kehi-jingu Shrine, then entered Kanegasaki-jo Castle in Echizen Province (Tsuruga City, Fukui Prefecture) on November 24.
sen.cmt: Imperial→imperial, he was→they were,received→welcomedthe, カンマを補いました。 建武3年10月13日→西暦1336年11月24日（グレゴリオ暦）として修正しました。(October 13 in the old calendar)はここでは必要ないと判断し、削除しました。
sen.e: Yoshisada NITTA descended the mountain with two imperial princes of the Emperor Godaigo: the Imperial Prince Tsuneyoshi and the Imperial Prince Takayoshi, and successfully escaped to the Hokuriku region where they were welcomed by Ujiharu KEHI who was Guji (chief of those who serves shrine, controls festivals and general affairs) of Kehi-jingu Shrine, then entered Kanegasaki-jo Castle in Echizen Province (Tsuruga City, Fukui Prefecture) on November 24.

sen.j: 義貞の入城直後、越前国守護斯波高経が率いる北朝方は金ヶ崎城を包囲した。
sen.e: Immediately after Yoshisada entered the castle, the Northern Court led by Echizen no kuni shugo (the Governor of Echizen Province) Takatsune SHIBA besieged Kanegasaki-jo Castle.
Immediately after Yoshisada entered the castle, the Northern Court led by Echizen no kuni shugo (the Governor of Echizen Province) Takatsune SHIBA besieged the Kanegasaki-jo Castle.
Immediately after Yoshisada entered the castle, the Northern Court led by Echizen no kuni shugo (the Governor of Echizen Province) Takatsune SHIBA besieged the Kanegasaki-jo Castle.

sen.j: 高経は、守りの堅い金ヶ崎城を攻めあぐね、兵糧攻めを行う。
sen.e: Takatsune struggled to attack Kanegasaki-jo Castle which had a strong defense and he starved the enemy out.
Takatsune struggled to conquer the Kanegasaki-jo Castle which had a strong defense, and he started to starve them out.
sen.cmt: attack→conquer と修正しました。starved the enemy out→started to starve them out と修正しました。（ここで全てが完結してしまってはいないので）the, カンマを補いました。
sen.e: Takatsune struggled to conquer the Kanegasaki-jo Castle which had a strong defense, and he started to starve them out.

sen.j: 翌1337年（延元2年/建武4年）、尊氏は高師泰ら援軍を派遣し、厳しく攻め立てる。
sen.e: The following year, in 1337, Takauji sent reinforcements including KO no Moroyasu and carried out violent attacks.
The following year, in 1337, Takauji sent reinforcements including KO no Moroyasu and carried out the violent attacks.
The following year, in 1337, Takauji sent reinforcements including KO no Moroyasu and carried out the violent attacks.

sen.j: 義貞は援軍を求めるため、二人の皇子と長男新田義顕らを残し、兵糧の尽きた金ヶ崎城を脱出する。
sen.e: In order to call for reinforcements, Yoshisada escaped from Kanegasaki-jo Castle where the provisions have run out, leaving two Imperial princes and his eldest son Yoshiaki NITTA.
In order to call for reinforcements for them, Yoshisada escaped from the Kanegasaki-jo Castle where the provisions had run out, leaving the two imperial princes and his eldest son Yoshiaki NITTA.
sen.cmt: for them を補いました。the を補いました。have→had,Imperial→imperial,eldest→oldest と修正しました。
sen.e: In order to call for reinforcements for them, Yoshisada escaped from the Kanegasaki-jo Castle where the provisions had run out, leaving the two imperial princes and his eldest son Yoshiaki NITTA.

sen.j: が、北朝方に阻まれ再び金ヶ崎城へ戻ることはできなかった。
sen.e: However, Yoshisada could not return to Kanegasaki-jo Castle because the Northern Court checked him in his course.
However, Yoshisada could not return to the Kanegasaki-jo Castle because the Northern Court side obstructed him in his way.
sen.cmt: the, side を補いました。checked→obstructed,course→way と修正しました。
sen.e: However, Yoshisada could not return to the Kanegasaki-jo Castle because the Northern Court side obstructed him in his way.

sen.j: 3月3日_(旧暦)、北朝方が金ヶ崎城に攻め込む。
sen.e: The Northern Court invaded Kanegasaki-jo Castle on April 4 (on March 3 in the old calendar).
The Northern Court side invaded the Kanegasaki-jo Castle on April 12.
sen.cmt: side, the を補いました。 建武4年3月3日→西暦1337年4月12日（グレゴリオ暦）として修正しました。カッコの旧暦部分は必要ないと判断し削除しました。
sen.e: The Northern Court side invaded the Kanegasaki-jo Castle on April 12.

sen.j: 兵糧攻めによる飢餓と疲労で城兵は次々と討ち取られ、3月6日_(旧暦)落城する。
sen.e: Johei (castle garrison) was killed one after another due to famine and fatigue caused by starvation tactics and the castle fell on April 7 (March 6 in the old calendar).
Johei (castle garrisons) were killed one after another due to famine and fatigue caused by the starvation tactics, and the castle fell on April 15.

sen.e: Johei (castle garrisons) were killed one after another due to famine and fatigue caused by the starvation tactics, and the castle fell on April 15.

sen.j: 尊良親王・新田義顕は自害し、恒良親王は北朝方に捕縛された。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Takayoshi and Yoshiaki NITTA killed themselves and Imperial Prince Tsuneyoshi was arrested by the Northern Court.
The Imperial Prince Takayoshi and Yoshiaki NITTA killed themselves and the Imperial Prince Tsuneyoshi was arrested by the Northern Court side.
